title: CRACK Attack Chain
description: Schema definition for CRACK attack chain artifacts.

description.description: Concise overview of the chain's purpose and expected outcome.

version.description: Semantic version for the attack chain definition (e.g. 1.0.0).

metadata.description: Author and classification metadata for the attack chain.

author.description: Primary author or maintainer of the chain.

created.description: Date the chain was originally authored (YYYY-MM-DD).

updated.description: Date the chain was last updated (YYYY-MM-DD).

tags.description: Topical tags for filtering and discovery.

category.description: High-level classification of the chain (e.g. privilege_escalation).

platform.description: Primary operating system or environment targeted by the chain.

difficulty.description: Relative difficulty of executing the chain end-to-end.

time_estimate.description: Estimated time required to complete the chain (e.g. '45 minutes').

oscp_relevant.description: Whether the chain is relevant to OSCP preparation and assessment.

prerequisites.description: Preconditions that must be satisfied before executing the chain.

notes.description: Additional free-form notes about the chain.

steps.description: Ordered list of steps that compose the attack chain.

id.description: Optional identifier for referencing the step within the chain.

name.description: Short descriptive title for the step.

objective.description: Goal that this step aims to achieve.

description.description: Detailed instructions or narrative for the step.

command_ref.description: Identifier of the command referenced by this step.

evidence.description: Artifacts or outputs expected from successful execution.

dependencies.description: IDs of steps that must be completed before this step can begin.

repeatable.description: Whether the step can be repeated multiple times within the chain.

failure_conditions.description: Common failure modes and how to detect them.

next_steps.description: Recommended follow-up actions or branches after completing the step.
